newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: FORECAST-Austria building output to shrink in 97.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Austria building output to shrink in 97.

text.p: Austrian building output will shrink 0.5 percent in real terms this year, hit by a sluggish housing market and slower-than-expected demand for renovations, semi-official economic research institute WIFO said on Friday.
"While the construction industry in much of western Europe picks up in 1997, output in Austria will be down in real terms," WIFO said in a statement.
It said a house-building boom that fizzled out in 1995 showed no signs of returning and demand for homes, particularly expensive homes, was in decline.

"It remains to be seen what impact the planned increase in public spending on infrastructure will have," WIFO continued. The government has promised to support infrastructure projects in a bid to tackle record unemployment.
WIFO said renovation and modernisation work was on the increase but noted growth had failed to match expectations.
The state statistical office has not yet published data on 1996 building output. -- Vienna newsroom, +43-1 531 12 254
